00040 #ifndef _physworld_cpp
00041 #define _physworld_cpp
00042 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00043 //The world that integrates everything
00044 //
00045 //This is where all the calls to the the underlying libraries should be from.
00046 //PhysWorld is an abstraction layer to all of the non-ui libraries. The ui
00047 //layers wx and ogre both have their own main loops, so it is almost mandatory
00048 //for other code to interact with those libraries directly.
00049 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00050 //Includes
00051 #include "physdatatypes.h"
00052 #include "physevent.h"
00053 #include "physworld.h"
00054 #include "physvector.h"

00056 #include "physworldcallbackmanager.h"
00057 #include "physgamesettings.h"
00058 #include "physmisc.h"
00059 #include "physactor.h"
00060 
00061 #include "SDL.h"
00062 #include "btBulletDynamicsCommon.h"
00063 #include "BulletSoftBody/btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld.h"

00070 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00071 // Physworld constructor
00072 //this should create the basic objects for stroing and tracking the roots of
00073 //objects in the game
00074 PhysWorld::PhysWorld()
00075 {
00076         this->Construct(
00077                 new PhysVector3(-100.0,-100.0,-100.0),
00078                 new PhysVector3(100.0, 100.0, 100.0),
00079                 10
00080                 );
00081 }
00082 
00083 PhysWorld::PhysWorld(PhysVector3* GeographyLowerBounds_, PhysVector3* GeographyUpperbounds_, unsigned short int  MaxPhysicsProxies_)
00084 {
00085         this->Construct(GeographyLowerBounds_, GeographyUpperbounds_, MaxPhysicsProxies_);
00086 }
00087 
00088 void PhysWorld::Construct(PhysVector3* GeographyLowerBounds_, PhysVector3* GeographyUpperbounds_, unsigned short int  MaxPhysicsProxies_)
00089 {
00090         PlayerSettings = new Settings();
00091 
00092         //We create our Ogre environment
00093         this->OgreRoot = new Ogre::Root(GetPluginsDotCFG(),GetSettingsDotCFG(),"Physgame.log");
00094 
00095         //Ogre resource related code
00096         /// @todo : From here to the logger tests should probably be moved to another file
00097     this->OgreRoot->addResourceLocation(GetDataDirectory(), "FileSystem", "Robot", false);
00098     this->OgreResource = Ogre::ResourceGroupManager::getSingletonPtr();
00099 
00100     /// @todo TODO remove Robot test code
00101     this->OgreResource->declareResource("robot.mesh", "Mesh", "Robot");
00102     this->OgreResource->declareResource("Examples.material", "Material", "Robot");
00103 
00104     // This Tests the Logger and Logs a few critical Items.
00105     TestLogger();
00106     //Perform a Test that only needs to be done once for the SDL/Physuserinputevent system.
00107     Log("Verifying size of userinput events:");
00108     Log(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode));
00109     Log(sizeof(SDLKey));
00110     if(sizeof(MetaCode::InputCode) != sizeof(SDLKey))
00111         {LogAndThrow("User input subsystem Event Sizes  Don't match, userinput subsystem will go down faster than 'that' girl on prom night.");}
00112     Log("They match, the User Input subsystem won't crash instantly");
00113 
00114     //Callbacks are the main way that a game using the PhysWorld will be able to have their code run at custom times
00115         this->CallBacks = new PhysWorldCallBackManager(this);
00116 
00117     //Events are the main way for the game using the physworld to  get information about the various subsystems
00118     this->Events = new PhysEventManager;
00119 
00120         //instantiate the Physics engine and related items
00121         GeographyLowerBounds = GeographyLowerBounds_;
00122         GeographyUpperbounds = GeographyUpperbounds_;
00123         MaxPhysicsProxies = MaxPhysicsProxies_;
00124 
00125         btVector3 worldAabbMin(GeographyLowerBounds->X, GeographyLowerBounds->Y, GeographyLowerBounds->Z);
00126         btVector3 worldAabbMax(GeographyUpperbounds->X, GeographyUpperbounds->Y, GeographyUpperbounds->Z);
00127 
00128         this->BulletBroadphase = new btAxisSweep3(worldAabbMin, worldAabbMax, MaxPhysicsProxies);
00129         this->BulletSolver = new btSequentialImpulseConstraintSolver;
00130         this->BulletCollisionConfiguration = new btDefaultCollisionConfiguration();
00131         this->BulletDispatcher = new btCollisionDispatcher(BulletCollisionConfiguration);
00132 
00133         this->BulletDynamicsWorld = new btSoftRigidDynamicsWorld(
00134                                                                                                 BulletDispatcher,
00135                                                                                                 BulletBroadphase,
00136                                                                                                 BulletSolver,
00137                                                                                                 BulletCollisionConfiguration);
00138 }

00140 void PhysWorld::TestLogger()
00141 {
00142     string temp0("0");
00143     char temp1 = 'a';
00144     short int temp2 = 2;
00145     int temp3 = 3;
00146     long int temp4 = 4;
00147     unsigned short int temp5 = 5;
00148     unsigned int temp6 = 6;
00149     unsigned long int temp7 = 7;
00150     bool temp8 = true;
00151     float temp9 = 0.9;
00152     double temp10 = 9.9999;
00153     long double temp11 = 11.00011;
00154     wchar_t temp12 = 'L';
00155     size_t temp13 = 13;
00156     PhysReal temp14 = 1.4;
00157     PhysWhole temp15 = 15;
00158     PhysString temp16("16 or so");
00159     PhysVector3 temp17(0,1,7);
00160 
00161     //dynamic_cast<PhysEvent*>// Add physevent as something that can be logged.
00162     //TODO add each type of event here to make it really wasy to log events
00163 
00164     OneLogTest(temp0, "string");
00165     OneLogTest(temp1, "char");
00166     OneLogTest(temp2, "short int");
00167     OneLogTest(temp3, "int");
00168     OneLogTest(temp4, "long int");
00169     OneLogTest(temp5, "unsigned short int");
00170     OneLogTest(temp6, "unsigned int");
00171     OneLogTest(temp7, "unsigned long int");
00172     OneLogTest(temp8, "bool");
00173     OneLogTest(temp9, "float");
00174     OneLogTest(temp10, "double");
00175     OneLogTest(temp11, "long double");
00176     OneLogTest(temp12, "wchar_t");
00177     OneLogTest(temp13, "size_t");
00178     OneLogTest(temp14, "PhysReal");
00179     OneLogTest(temp15, "PhysWhole");
00180     OneLogTest(temp16, "PhysString");
00181     OneLogTest(temp17, "PhysVector3");
00182 }
00183 
00184 template <class T> void PhysWorld::OneLogTest(T Data, string DataType, string Message1, string Message2)
00185 {
00186     try
00187     {
00188         Log(Message1+DataType);
00189         LogAndThrow(Data);
00190     } catch (T excepted) {
00191         Log(Message2+DataType);
00192         Log(excepted);
00193     }
00194 }
00195 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00196 //tears the world down
00197 PhysWorld::~PhysWorld()
00198 {
00199         //Destroy the physical world that we loved and cherished
00200         //dWorldDestroy(this->OdeWorld);
00201         delete GeographyLowerBounds;
00202         delete GeographyUpperbounds;
00203         delete BulletBroadphase;
00204         delete BulletCollisionConfiguration;
00205         delete BulletDispatcher;
00206         delete BulletSolver;
00207         delete BulletDynamicsWorld;
00208 
00209         //All the pointers Ogre made should get taken care of by OGRE
00210         delete OgreRoot;
00211 
00212         //clear up our objects
00213         delete CallBacks;
00214         delete Events;
00215 
00216 
00217         delete PlayerSettings;
00218 
00219         SDL_FreeSurface(SDLscreen);
00220 
00221         //remove sdl stuff
00222         void SDL_Quit(void);
00223 }

00225 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00226 //appends to the gamelog which is managed by Ogre
00227 template <class T> void PhysWorld::Log(T Message)
00228 {
00229         stringstream temp;
00230         temp << Message;
00231         Ogre::LogManager::getSingleton().logMessage(temp.str());
00232 }
00233 
00234 template <class T> void PhysWorld::LogAndThrow(T Message)
00235 {
00236         this->Log(Message);
00237         throw(Message);
00238 }

00240 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00241 //Shows the ogre settings Dialog, and allows it to save settings to ogres
00242 //preset save location
00243 bool PhysWorld::ShowSystemSettingDialog()
00244 {
00245         try
00246         {
00247                 return this->OgreRoot->showConfigDialog();
00248         } catch (exception& e) {
00249                 this->Log("Ogre settings windows from main UI or mandatory setting failure");
00250                 this->Log(e.what());
00251                 return false;
00252         }
00253 }

00255 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00256 // Start the Game already
00257 void PhysWorld::GameInit()
00258 {
00259         //try to load the ogre config
00260         this->LoadOgreSettings();
00261         this->CreateRenderWindow();
00262 
00263     //Create a the RenderTimer, which will be used to measure the time
00264     Ogre::Timer RenderTimer;
00265 
00266         bool Callbackbools[] = {true, true, true, true};
00267 
00268         //Used for tracking times to prevent Infinite render loops in graphically simple games
00269         //PhysWhole Times[] = {0,0,0,0};
00270 
00271         /// @todo TODO finish test code, there is a bunch of sloppy test code for the robot in the gameinit
00272         this->OgreResource->initialiseResourceGroup("Robot");
00273         this->OgreSceneManager->setAmbientLight( Ogre::ColourValue( 1, 1, 1 ) );
00274         Ogre::Entity *ent1 = this->OgreSceneManager->createEntity( "Robot", "robot.mesh" );
00275         Ogre::SceneNode *node1 = this->OgreSceneManager->getRootSceneNode()->createChildSceneNode( "RobotNode" );
00276         node1->attachObject( ent1 );
00277 
00278     PhysWhole FrameDelay = 0;
00279     PhysWhole FrameTime = 0;
00280 
00281     /// @page MainLoop
00282     /// The MainLoop does stuffs that needs to be documented
00283     /// @todo actually document the gameloop
00284         /// The Main loop begins in PhysGame.GameInit(). Once started it runs the callbacks present in the callback manager until one of them
00285         /// Returns false. It has a pretty specific work flow
00286         //As long as all the CallBacks return true the game continues
00287         while (Callbackbools[0] && Callbackbools[1] && Callbackbools[2] && Callbackbools[3])
00288         {
00289         //To prepare each callback we add an event to the event manager which includes the time since th last frame render ended
00290         //However we will only do this if a callback is set
00291         if(this->CallBacks->IsPreInputCallbackSet())
00292         {
00293                         this->Events->AddEvent(new PhysEventRenderTime(FrameTime));
00294                         Callbackbools[0] = this->CallBacks->PreInput();
00295                         this->DoMainLoopInputBuffering();
00296         }
00297 
00298                 if(this->CallBacks->IsPrePhysicsCallbackSet())
00299         {
00300             this->Events->AddEvent(new PhysEventRenderTime(FrameTime));
00301                         Callbackbools[1] = this->CallBacks->PrePhysics();
00302                         this->DoMainLoopPhysics();
00303         }
00304 
00305                 if(this->CallBacks->IsPreRenderCallbackSet())
00306         {
00307             this->Events->AddEvent(new PhysEventRenderTime(FrameTime));
00308                         Callbackbools[2] = this->CallBacks->PreRender();
00309                         this->DoMainLoopWindowManagerBuffering();
00310         }
00311 
00312                 //Render the frame and figure the amount of time it took //Limit frame rate to 62.5
00313                 this->DoMainLoopRender();
00314                 FrameTime = RenderTimer.getMilliseconds();
00315                 RenderTimer.reset();
00316                 if(16>FrameTime){                               //use 16666 for microseconds
00317                     FrameDelay++;
00318                         WaitMilliseconds( FrameDelay );
00319                 }else if(16==FrameTime){
00320         }else{
00321             if (0<FrameDelay){
00322                 FrameDelay--;
00323             }else{
00324                 FrameDelay=0;
00325             }
00326         }
00327 
00328                 if(this->CallBacks->IsPostRenderCallbackSet())
00329         {
00330                         this->Events->AddEvent(new PhysEventRenderTime(FrameTime));
00331                         Callbackbools[3] = this->CallBacks->PostRender();
00332         }
00333 
00334         }//End of main loop
00335 
00336         //Some after loop cleanup
00337         this->DestroyRenderWindow();
00338 }

00340 void PhysWorld::MoveCamera(PhysVector3 Position, PhysVector3 LookAt)
00341 {
00342         this->OgreCamera->setPosition(Ogre::Vector3(Position.X,Position.Y,Position.Z));
00343     this->OgreCamera->lookAt(Ogre::Vector3(LookAt.X,LookAt.Y,LookAt.Z));
00344 }

00346 void PhysWorld::DoMainLoopAllItems()
00347 {
00348         this->DoMainLoopPhysics();
00349         this->DoMainLoopWindowManagerBuffering();
00350         this->DoMainLoopInputBuffering();
00351         this->DoMainLoopRender();
00352 }

00360 void PhysWorld::DoMainLoopWindowManagerBuffering()
00361 {
00362     this->PreProcessSDLEvents();
00363     Log("WM EventCount Pending:");
00364     Log(SDL_WmEvents.size());
00365     //TODO: make Physevents for each of the events in SDL_W1111mEvents(and delete the SDL events)
00366 }
00367 
00368 void PhysWorld::DoMainLoopInputBuffering()
00369 {
00370     this->PreProcessSDLEvents();
00371     Log("User Input EventCount Pending:");
00372     Log(SDL_UserInputEvents.size());
00373 
00374     PhysEventUserInput FromSDLEvents;
00375 
00376     /// @todo TODO: make Physevents for each of the events in SDL_WmEvents(and delete the SDL events)
00377     //RawEvent QueueEvent;
00378     while( !SDL_UserInputEvents.empty() )
00379     {
00380         SDL_Event * CurrentEvent = SDL_UserInputEvents.front();
00381         this->Log(GetNameOfEventFrom(CurrentEvent));
00382 
00383         SDL_UserInputEvents.pop();
00384     }//*/
00385 }
00386 
00387 void PhysWorld::DoMainLoopRender()
00388 {
00389         RenderPhysWorld(this);
00390 }

00399 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00400 //Loads the Ogre Configuration
00401 void PhysWorld::LoadOgreSettings()
00402 {
00403         //Try loading from the default location
00404         if (!this->OgreRoot->restoreConfig())
00405     {
00406         //if we can't do that then lets make new settings
00407         if (!this->ShowSystemSettingDialog())
00408         {
00409                 this->LogAndThrow("Error 1: Could not setup Ogre.");
00410                 }
00411     }
00412 
00413 }
00414 
00415 //Seriously read the Function Name
00416 void PhysWorld::CreateRenderWindow()
00417 {
00418         //Get what is needed for SDL started
00419         if (SDL_Init(SDL_INIT_VIDEO) < 0) {
00420                 this->Log("Error 2: Unable to init SDL, SDL Error Follows:");
00421                 this->LogAndThrow(SDL_GetError());
00422         }
00423 
00424         //Setup the SDL render window
00425         this->SDLscreen = SDL_SetVideoMode(PlayerSettings->getRenderHeight(), PlayerSettings->getRenderWidth(), 0, SDL_OPENGL);
00426     SDL_WM_SetCaption("Catch!", NULL);
00427 
00428         //Start Ogre Without a native render window
00429         this->OgreGameWindow = this->OgreRoot->initialise(false, "physgame");
00430 
00431         //Configure Ogre to render to the SDL window
00432         Ogre::NameValuePairList *misc;
00433         misc=(Ogre::NameValuePairList*) GetSDLOgreBinder();
00434         (*misc)["title"] = Ogre::String("Catch!");
00435         this->OgreGameWindow = this->OgreRoot->createRenderWindow("physgame", PlayerSettings->getRenderHeight(), PlayerSettings->getRenderWidth(), PlayerSettings->getFullscreen(), misc);
00436     //Added following lines to attempt to make the render window visable
00437     //this->OgreGameWindow->setVisible(true);
00438         //this->OgreGameWindow->setActive(true);
00439     //this->OgreGameWindow->setAutoUpdated(true);
00440 
00441         //prepare a scenemanager
00442         this->OgreSceneManager = this->OgreRoot->createSceneManager(Ogre::ST_GENERIC,"SceneManager");
00443 
00444         //setup a default camera
00445         this->OgreCamera = this->OgreSceneManager->createCamera("Camera");
00446         this->OgreCamera->setNearClipDistance(5.0f);
00447     this->OgreCamera->setFarClipDistance(5000.0f);
00448 
00449         this->MoveCamera(PhysVector3(0.0f,0.0f,500.0f), PhysVector3(0.0f,0.0f,0.0f));
00450 
00451         //viewport connects camera and render window
00452         this->OgreViewport = this->OgreGameWindow->addViewport(OgreCamera);
00453 
00454         //setting the aspect ratio must be done after we setup the viewport
00455         this->OgreCamera->setAspectRatio( Ogre::Real(OgreViewport->getActualWidth()) / Ogre::Real(OgreViewport->getActualHeight()) );
00456 }
00457 
00458 void PhysWorld::DestroyRenderWindow()
00459 {
00460     this->OgreGameWindow->destroy();
00461 }

00463 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00464 // Deals with SDL
00465 
00466 
00467 //This function will get all the events from SDL and Sort them into one of two Queues
00468 void PhysWorld::PreProcessSDLEvents()
00469 {
00470     RawEvent temp;
00471     RawEvent* FromSDL=&temp;
00472         while(SDL_PollEvent(FromSDL))
00473         {
00474             RawEvent* ScopeHolder = new RawEvent;
00475             *ScopeHolder = temp;
00476         switch(FromSDL->type)
00477         {
00478             case SDL_ACTIVEEVENT:   //when the window gains focus
00479             case SDL_VIDEORESIZE:   //when the screen is resized
00480             case SDL_VIDEOEXPOSE:   //when the windows goes from being hidden to being shown
00481             case SDL_QUIT:          //when SDL closes
00482             case SDL_SYSWMEVENT:
00483                 SDL_WmEvents.push(ScopeHolder);
00484                 break;
00485             case SDL_KEYDOWN:
00486             case SDL_KEYUP:
00487             case SDL_MOUSEMOTION:
00488             case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONDOWN:
00489             case SDL_MOUSEBUTTONUP:
00490             case SDL_JOYAXISMOTION:
00491             case SDL_JOYBUTTONDOWN:
00492             case SDL_JOYBUTTONUP:
00493             case SDL_JOYBALLMOTION:
00494             case SDL_JOYHATMOTION:
00495                 SDL_UserInputEvents.push(ScopeHolder);
00496                 break;
00497             case SDL_USEREVENT://Never thrown by SDL, but could be added by a user
00498             default:
00499                 throw ("Unknown SDL Event Inserted");
00500                 break;
00501         }
00502         }
00503 }
